snippet: Even as Sony’s electronics unit rebounded a bit, the Japanese company said it was weighing “carefully” a shareholder proposal to spin off part of its entertainment arm.
abstract: Sony of Japan posts second-quarter net income of 3.5 billion yen, or $35 million, up from loss of 24.6 billion yen in same period year earlier; results are aided by weaker yen and increased sales of smartphones.

byline.original: By ERIC PFANNER and MICHAEL CIEPLY
byline.contributor: Eric Pfanner reported from Tokyo and Michael Cieply from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Even as Sony’s electronics unit rebounded a bit, the Japanese company said it was weighing “carefully” a shareholder proposal to spin off part of its entertainment arm.

headline.main: Signs of Rebound as Sony Posts a $35 Million Profit
headline.print_headline: Signs of Rebound as Sony Posts a $35 Million Profit
